summary: The paper "On the Last Kervaire Invariant Problem" by Weinan Lin and two other authors resolves the final case of the Kervaire invariant problem by proving that the element $h_6^2$ is a permanent cycle in the Adams spectral sequence. This result establishes the existence of smooth framed manifolds with Kervaire invariant one in dimension 126, and when combined with the theorems of Browder, Mahowald--Tangora, Barratt--Jones--Mahowald, and Hill--Hopkins--Ravenel, it is concluded that smooth framed manifolds with Kervaire invariant one exist in and only in dimensions 2, 6, 14, 30, 62, and 126. The paper is published in the journal Differential Geometry (math. DG) and Geometric Topology (math. GT) with the DOI number 10.48550/arXiv.2412.10879.

The paper "On the Last Kervaire Invariant Problem" by Weinan Lin, Guozhen Wang, and Zhouli Xu presents a proof that the element h2 6 is a permanent cycle in the Adams spectral sequence, which resolves the final case of the Kervaire invariant problem. The authors use a combination of computational methods and theoretical tools to establish this result, including the use of the May spectral sequence, the Leibniz rule, and the Mahowald trick. The paper also provides a summary of the history of the Kervaire invariant problem and its relationship to other problems in differential topology.
